page.title: 18 A NATURE RESERVE
page.content: Local residents formed the Friends of Hollywood in June 1981 in response to a threat that woodland was to be redeveloped for housing. Having successfully defeated the proposal they determined to conserve the wood's natural character for people and the indigenous wildlife. It is situated on either side of the M6 motorway flyover between Junctions 6 and 7. Foxes, squirrels and hedgehogs are often spotted amongst the birch, oak and sycamore. In spring bluebells carpet the area, followed by rhododendron in late May and June. Apart from the more common birds, residents often hear jays, warblers and great spotted woodpeckers. Local people manage the wood with advice from the Urban Wildlife Group and Sandwell Metropolitan Borough Council.
